metadata.name: Butterfly-woman
metadata.description:
A unique animation of a bookplate made by Mark F. Severin, opus 274 (1973). 
'Urania Fastuosa L.'
The original work is a paper print made from an engraving on a copper plate.
Mark Severin was a Belgian artist (1906 - 1987) that made around 500 bookplates (ex-libris) engraved in wood, copper or steel.
His art is influenced by the beauty of nature and women.
He is considered as one of the best engravers of the 20th century. 
The animation is made by Ronny Mark Makepeace Severin, grandson of Mark F. Severin.
It is ode to my grandfather, a mutation of his art into something vitual and alive.
